Detailed Description

This AnalogueModel models implements the Ghassmezadeh stochastic UWB channel models.

Citation of the following publication is appreciated if you use the MiXiM UWB PHY model for a publication of your own. J. Rousselot, J.-D. Decotignie, An ultra-wideband impulse radio PHY layer model for network simulation. SIMULATION January 2011 vol. 87 no. 1-2 82-112.

For more information, see also:

[1] J. Rousselot, J.-D. Decotignie, An ultra-wideband impulse radio PHY layer model for network simulation. SIMULATION January 2011 vol. 87 no. 1-2 82-112. http://dx.doi.org/10.1177/0037549710377767 [2] J. Rousselot, Ultra Low Power Communication Protocols for UWB Impulse Radio Wireless Sensor Networks. EPFL Thesis 4720, 2010. http://infoscience.epfl.ch/record/147987 [3] A High-Precision Ultra Wideband Impulse Radio Physical Layer Model for Network Simulation, Jérôme Rousselot, Jean-Dominique Decotignie, Second International Omnet++ Workshop,Simu'TOOLS, Rome, 6 Mar 09. http://portal.acm.org/citation.cfm?id=1537714

Definition at line 53 of file UWBIRStochasticPathlossModel.h.

Member Function Documentation

void UWBIRStochasticPathlossModel::filterSignal ( AirFrame *  frame,
const Coord &  sendersPos,
const Coord &  receiverPos 
) [virtual]

Has to be overriden by every implementation.

Filters a specified AirFrame's Signal by adding an attenuation over time to the Signal.

Parameters:
frame The incomming frame.
sendersPos The position of the frame sender.
receiverPos The position of frame receiver.

Implements AnalogueModel.

References Signal::addAttenuation(), Coord::distance(), and TimeMapping< Interpolator >::setValue().

00045 {
00046   if (isEnabled) {
00047     Signal& signal = frame->getSignal();
00048     // Initialize objects and variables
00049     TimeMapping<Linear>* attMapping = new TimeMapping<Linear> ();
00050     Argument arg;
00051 
00052     // Generate channel.
00053     // assume channel coherence during whole frame
00054 
00055     n1 = simtruncnormal(0, 1, n1_limit, 1);
00056     n2 = simtruncnormal(0, 1, n2_limit, 2);
00057     n3 = simtruncnormal(0, 1, n2_limit, 3);
00058 
00059     gamma = mu_gamma + n1 * sigma_gamma;
00060     sigma = mu_sigma + n3 * sigma_sigma;
00061     S = n2 * sigma;
00062 
00063     // Determine distance between sender and receiver
00064     double distance    = receiverPos.distance(sendersPos);
00065     /*
00066      srcPosX.record(senderPos.x);
00067      srcPosY.record(senderPos.y);
00068      dstPosX.record(receiverPos.x);
00069      dstPosY.record(receiverPos.y);
00070      distances.record(distance);
00071      */
00072     // Compute pathloss
00073     double attenuation = getGhassemzadehPathloss(distance);
00074     pathlosses.record(attenuation);
00075     //attenuation = attenuation / (4*PI*pow(distance, gamma));
00076     // Store scalar mapping
00077     attMapping->setValue(arg, attenuation);
00078     signal.addAttenuation(attMapping);
00079   }
00080 }
